meanings.definition: Make or declare (something, typically a church) sacred; dedicate formally to a religious or divine purpose.
meanings.sent1: The priest consecrated the new church with a special ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The community consecrated the temple with prayers and hymns.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels consecrated their secret acorn stash with a tiny dance.
meanings.sent4: Her words consecrated the moment with a sense of peace and unity.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streaming through the stained glass windows consecrated the room with a warm glow.

meanings.definition: Having been made or declared sacred; dedicated formally to a religious or divine purpose.
meanings.sent1: The consecrated ground felt peaceful and serene.
meanings.sent2: The consecrated artifacts were displayed in a special exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The consecrated cupcakes disappeared quickly at the bake sale.
meanings.sent4: Her consecrated necklace was a family heirloom passed down for generations.
meanings.sent5: The consecrated river flowed gently through the valley, bringing life to all around.
